description: Area Development Programme Balochistan Phase II

subproject.corporate outcome: Capacities of national and local institutions enhanced to scale up proven MDG acceleration interventions and to plan, monitor, report and evaluate the MDG progress in the context of related national development priorities
subproject.description:
: The objective of Balochistan Poverty Reduction Programme is to reduce poverty in deprived valleys in 9 districts (Musakhel, Loralai, Qila Saifullah, Ziarat, Pishin, Quetta, Mastung, Kalat and Khuzdar) in Balochistan by mobilizing communities and developing their capacities; increasing agricultural and livestock productivity; improving access to social services; developing vocational skills; training in IT; creating income generation opportunities; conserving natural resources; and strengthening women’s role.  The purpose is to upscale the sustainable development models developed during the first phase.  It will be implemented by P&DD, Govt. of Balochistan with the assistance of technical project staff for 4 years from 2006 – 2009.  The programme aims at directly benefiting 90,000 poor individuals.  The capacity of Community Organizations, P&DD and other concerned departments will also be strengthened in order to ensure sustainable development in the region after the programme period. This programme is the 2nd phase of the Area Development Programme Balochistan (ADPB), which has been implemented from April 1999 to December 2004.  In accordance with recommendations of review mission and lessons learned, BPRP will put stronger emphasis on social organization, human resource development, and monitoring and evaluation activities.

Access of communities to productive assets and services facilitated.
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.title: PRU-ADPB Phase II
